meanings.definition: A body of magistrates in ancient Sparta.
meanings.sent1: The ephorate in ancient Sparta made important decisions for the city.
meanings.sent2: The ephorate was responsible for overseeing the legal matters in Sparta.
meanings.sent3: The ephorate in Sparta must have been a busy group of officials!
meanings.sent4: The ephorate's role in Sparta was like the beating heart of the city.
meanings.sent5: The ephorate's authority in Sparta was unmatched.

meanings.definition: The office or term of office of an ephor.
meanings.sent1: During his ephorate, he implemented new policies for the city.
meanings.sent2: The ephorate of the official lasted for one year.
meanings.sent3: The ephorate's responsibilities must have kept them on their toes!
meanings.sent4: The ephorate's term was a time of great change for the city.
meanings.sent5: The ephorate's duties were crucial for the city's well-being.
